item.title: Art With Monte Carlo
item.description: I like to think of Monte Carlo as a counting method. If a condition is satisfied we make a note (e.g., 1), and if the condition is not satisfied we make a different note (e.g., 0). We then iterate and evaluate the pattern of 1’s and 0’s to learn about our process. Art can be described in a similar way: if a condition is satisfied we use a color, and if a condition is not satisfied we use a different color.
